issuing_body: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Office of the Deputy Secretary, ASTP/ONC
document_title: Request for Information: Accelerating the Adoption and Use of Artificial Intelligence as Part of Clinical Care
summary_plain_language: The Department of Health and Human Services is requesting public input on actions it could take to accelerate the adoption and use of artificial intelligence in clinical care.
who_it_applies_to: Members of the public and stakeholders with interest or involvement in artificial intelligence and clinical care
what_changed: Publication of a request for information seeking public comment; no regulatory requirements were announced
recommended_action: Review the request for information and consider submitting public comments if relevant

document_title: Request for Information (RFI) on Partnerships for Transformational Artificial Intelligence Models
summary_plain_language: The Department of Energy is requesting public input on how it should structure and enable partnerships to curate Department of Energy scientific data for use in artificial intelligence models, including models intended to improve themselves for science and engineering applications.
who_it_applies_to: Industry participants, think tanks, investors, research organizations, and other stakeholders interested in artificial intelligence, scientific data, and partnerships with the Department of Energy
what_changed: Publication of a request for information seeking public comment; no regulatory requirements or obligations were introduced
recommended_action: Review the request for information and submit public comments if relevant

issuing_body: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
document_title: NIST Launches Centers for AI in Manufacturing and Critical Infrastructure
summary_plain_language: The National Institute of Standards and Technology announced the launch of centers focused on artificial intelligence in manufacturing and critical infrastructure and expanded its collaboration with a nonprofit organization as part of efforts related to artificial intelligence leadership.
who_it_applies_to: Organizations and stakeholders involved in artificial intelligence, manufacturing, and critical infrastructure
what_changed: Announcement of new centers and expanded collaboration related to artificial intelligence; no binding requirements were introduced
recommended_action: Monitor the initiative and review available information if participation or alignment is relevant

issuing_body: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
document_title: Draft NIST Guidelines Rethink Cybersecurity for the AI Era
summary_plain_language: The National Institute of Standards and Technology released draft guidelines intended to help organizations consider how to incorporate artificial intelligence into operations while addressing cybersecurity risks.
who_it_applies_to: Organizations considering or using artificial intelligence in their operations
what_changed: Release of draft, non-binding guidance related to artificial intelligence and cybersecurity; no mandatory requirements were established
recommended_action: Review the draft guidelines and consider providing feedback or evaluating internal practices in light of the guidance

issuing_body: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
document_title: CAISI Evaluation of DeepSeek AI Models Finds Shortcomings and Risks
summary_plain_language: The National Institute of Standards and Technology, through its Center for AI Standards and Innovation, evaluated selected artificial intelligence models developed by DeepSeek and reported identified shortcomings and potential risks based on the evaluation.
who_it_applies_to: Developers, deployers, and other stakeholders with interest in the evaluated artificial intelligence models
what_changed: Publication of technical evaluation results identifying shortcomings and potential risks; no regulatory or compliance requirements were introduced
recommended_action: Review the evaluation findings if relevant to the use, development, or assessment of similar artificial intelligence models

issuing_body: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
document_title: NIST Guidelines Can Help Organizations Detect Face Photo Morphs, Deter Identity Fraud
summary_plain_language: The National Institute of Standards and Technology released technical guidance intended to help organizations detect face photo morphing techniques associated with identity fraud.
who_it_applies_to: Organizations involved in identity verification, authentication, or fraud prevention
what_changed: Release of non-binding technical guidance related to detecting face photo morphing; no mandatory requirements were introduced
recommended_action: Review the guidance and consider its relevance to identity verification or fraud detection processes
